violations.description: No try-catch block found. TokenExpiredError: jwt expired - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST wrap jwt.verify() in try-catch block or use callback error-first pattern. TokenExpiredError indicates legitimate expiration - handle gracefully with 401 response and prompt user to refresh token or re-authenticate.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. NotBeforeError: jwt not active - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle NotBeforeError. Token is valid but not yet active. Either reject with 401 or retry after specified date.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. JsonWebTokenError: invalid signature - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle JsonWebTokenError for invalid signatures. This indicates tampering or wrong secret/key. CRITICAL security event - log and reject with 403. Never expose error details to client.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. JsonWebTokenError: jwt malformed - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle JsonWebTokenError for malformed tokens. Invalid structure indicates corrupted token or attack. Reject with 400 or 403.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. JsonWebTokenError: invalid algorithm - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle algorithm mismatch errors. This prevents CVE-2015-9235 algorithm confusion attack. Always specify algorithms option in verify().

violations.description: No try-catch block found. JsonWebTokenError: jwt audience invalid. expected: [expected] - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle audience validation errors when using options.audience. Audience mismatch indicates token intended for different service.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. JsonWebTokenError: jwt issuer invalid. expected: [expected] - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle issuer validation errors when using options.issuer. Issuer mismatch indicates token from untrusted source.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. JsonWebTokenError: secret or public key must be provided - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle missing secret errors. This typically indicates configuration error (missing environment variable). Fatal error - should fail fast on application startup, not at runtime.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Error: Expected 'payload' to be a plain object, Buffer, or string - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST validate payload type before calling jwt.sign() or wrap in try-catch. Common when payload is null, undefined, or Promise object (forgot await on database query).

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Error: secretOrPrivateKey must have a value - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST ensure secret exists before calling jwt.sign(). Missing secret indicates configuration error. Should fail fast on startup, not at runtime during login.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Error: 'algorithm' must be a valid string enum value - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST validate algorithm option. Common mistake: typo in algorithm name (e.g., 'HS-256' instead of 'HS256').

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Error: invalid expiresIn option - this will crash the application.
